--- title: "Week 3" subtitle: "Extract, Transform and Load" editor: visual --- Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) constitutes a process in data warehousing. This process involves extracting data from diverse sources, subsequently transforming it into a structure compatible with data warehouse requirements, and ultimately loading it into the designated repository. ETL encompasses the following three stages: * Extract data from various sources; * Transform data into a suitable format for loading into the data warehouse; * Load data into data warehouse. The `tidyverse` library is assumed to be loaded for all materials: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) ``` ::: ## Prepare 📖 [ETL Philosophy](/contents/week-3/01_ETL.qmd) 📖 [Extract](/contents/week-3/02_extract.qmd) 📖 [Transform](/contents/week-3/03_transform.qmd) 📖 [Load](/contents/week-3/04_load.qmd) 📖 [Automation and Scheduling](/contents/week-3/05_automation.qmd) 📖 [Monitoring and Logging](/contents/week-3/06_monitoring.qmd) ## Source code 🧑‍💻 [Source code](/contents/week-3/source/all_code_chunks.R) ## Questionnaire ⌨️ [Questionnaire](/questionnaire/qcm-week-3.qmd) ## Practice 📋 [Tutorials](/labs/lab-week-3.qmd) ⌨️ [Solution proposal](/labs/solutions/week-3.R)
